content: Amazing fun. Jumped in expecting something like FTL, pleased to say it is an excellent game that stands on its own. The graphics are stylish, the game play is fun with lots of replay ability and the story is good too.

Starts out fantastic, but gets very tedious very quickly. Going through a chapter while building your ship and crew is challenging and fun, but then starting over in the next chapter makes it feel like I'm on a treadmill. The story seems interesting, but not interesting enough to deal with the monotony. I'm on chapter 3/normal and I'm quitting. Not worth the money paid.
Immersive story, and no run is the same twice. So much fun.
Fun. Repayable. Ship builder is random so difficultly varies. Would be more fun if you could carry ships or save ships for levels

I have this game on PC and love it. This is an excellent port to mobile and tablet. Its insanely immersive. Runs smoothly. However beware you need a phone with a large screen, 5 inches or bigger or a tablet to get the most out of it.
Awsome
The game is definitely one of the bests!!!
Love it. Thoughtful combat and interesting dialog.

The story and art style of the game is extremely good but the gameplay can get really tedious after an hour or so. If I knew how bad the combat could get I would've refunded this game but I read through the story at the beginning.
Worth the buy awesome strategy game play and decisions highly recommend

Very fun offline fun! Great story and replay value is very possible. Just scratching the surface so far. Unfinished on 1st play on ez after a restart. Idk much of the story yet. More stars later maybe :)
Fantastic story, great gameplay
Very awesome
Great story keeps you invested
Great, but too much dialogue, negative 1 ⭐.
Out There meets FTL meets Dune meets roguelite

Very fun and difficult, but gets tedious/repetitive. Scenarios/events/anomalies get very repetitive. I gave up at like chapter 5 because i stopped encountering new things, or the new anomalies that i did encounter, were really unsatisfying. Which could be because i died a lot... So i tried easy mode, but that was way too easy and wasn't fun. That being said, i did quite a bunch of good hours of play out of it, so overall recommend it.

Well this is way better on mobile. The pixel art and large window to see the universe. Just works better on Mobil. Game is fun and has a expanding story that continues after you die and you will die. A run may last about 15 to 20 minutes. Perfect for lunch break.
Great game, lots of options and great story line. Similar to FTL but with more plot and less ship systems management.
This is a golden standard of mobile video games
Great rogue like game similar to FTL but with a deep story!
Lots of fun!
This game is truly premium
Amazing game. It's definitely worth the money.

Good but it should but it would be loads better on a tablet, on my phone it's very difficult to make out the dialogue and the controls are too small. Unfortunately not available for either my Lenovo tablet or Samsung tab 10 which is a real shame as it's barely playable on my phone.

Before I write the review, I want to make a suggestion to all future players with SPOTIFY to play this game with Music turned OFF in the games settings then open Spotify and play The Expanse (tv series) soundtrack in the background. Fun and Interesting game. Pro's •Lots of replayability when focusing on certain stratergies •interesting graphics •interesting story but for those who are not interested you can skip most dialogue Con's •Certain events are fairly repetitive •no mod support
I never played FTL - but this game is awesome. My current favorite rogue-like. If you enjoy Rogue-likes on Android, try: Delver, Wayward Souls, and Dead Age.

Despite getting used to some of the clunkiness of this port, it is a really solid play. I enjoy the squadron combat and aesthetic of the scavenging actions the most. Absolutely worth $8. If you're a usual rouge like gamer maybe start on hard.
A fantastic amazing game.
Restarting with each chapter really takes from the experience.
Really really good game.
Fantastic gameplay with a really compelling story and great world building. The art style is gorgeous! And truly some of the best gameplay in a mobile game

Great game! Classic sci-fi story with voxel gfx set and a great soundtrack. The combat can be a little fiddly at times, it's both complex but also lacking in some parts. Still would happily recommend!
This a fantastic example of what mobile gaming can be. The roguelike elements and the strategy will keep you occupied through thouse long trips and unexpected downtime. 5 stars all around!
Immersive and robust, it's worth every dollar.
Great port of a great PC game, only wish saves were shared between the systems.

I played this first on PC when epic had it for free and kept thinking "this would be a great game for the phone" and I was right ha. The story is interesting, the combat is fun, but the whole game is in your planning. If you like strategy games, maybe something like xcom or civilization, you'll probably like this. Resource management is key, plus a little luck. Graphics are pretty nice for mobile too. I've been playing this for hours now and it's just a few bucks, I say try it out!
Great game. Los of fun.
Excellent game. Story and gameplay are outstanding
Perfect game. But mobile version battlefield is too small and there is no zoom. So if your device smaller than 6.5" or even better 8", choice pc version
A great FTL like game, with more in depth and story content!

Wow I've been looking forward toward this one and so far it does nor disappoint. I'm a big fan of FTL and this ranks right up there booth games have a lot going for them. This game is definitely worth it. Easily recommend.
Great combo of FTL and Into the Breach. Great replay value and often challenging trade offs.

Pros: Beautiful and well polished. I was attracted to it, as with similar games, because of the roguelike piece. Story is above average. Cons: The battle is a bit boring and detracts from the game for me. Lots of pausing makes me feel like it should turned based instead of half real time. Encounters become repetitive and loses its appeal.
Worth the price of entry. Fun to play, can be enjoyed in small sessions.
No ChromeOS support.
This is a great game with an intriguing storyline. The rogue-lite formula works well for me. The nods to Space Renegades gave me a chuckle.

The game is good, a game extremely similar to a game called FTL (Faster Than Light) but with a story, the game is good, with a nice story, but the ending felt underwhelming as well as the buildup to the ending, the combat is fun, but eventually it just becomes pretty easy, it all comes down to how lucky you get with random encounters, that and a bit of skill, the ending felt empty, as the answer just doesnt answer anything beyond who caused the shutdown and what happens after, good game overall
Cool story and fun game play
Crying shame this took so long to come out for everyone. I think development started long ago. It's a fun game, though. I still enjoy it.
This is the strategic space battle fix I needed while I wait to play No Man's Sky on a PS5.
Loved playing this game and enjoyed the story. It took a bit to figure out the battle controls, but well worth sticking with it.
Best mobile game i Ever played
Raises the bar for mobile games.
Fantastic game. A rogue-like with a compelling story! Who knew such things were even possible.
Awesome space rpg, I like the battle mechanics and strategy. Had a couple of crashes, but nothing major.

I don't often play rouge-lites, but this one is quite the gem. The combat system makes a lot of sense and the story is captivating as well. I could definitely see how those playing on smaller devices would have trouble navigating the game. Overall, worth the cash!

So many others have said this, but to reiterate. If you've ever enjoyed FTL or battlevoid then BUY THIS! It's the same as those games, just more and better. The story is interesting so far. Short, reasonable clips with genuinely decent to great dialogue. Random stuff that happens and the options you're given to mitigate risks are interesting and reasonably affordable. Higher difficulty require a lot of good strategy execution and knowledge of your target. High replay value. That's my 500.

I saw an ad for this game online and figured I'd give it a shot, I was always a fan of FTL and Slay the Spire, so I figured I would enjoy this game. I do, I purchased it both on here and on steam, the art style is fantastic, the gameplay and ship battles are what I've been craving from a game. I do miss the crew management from FTL the fleet mechanics are awesome. EDIT: I left my game to write this review and I lost all my progress, about 5 hours worth. It loses 2 stars for that. :(

Captivating game. Reminds me of 'Out There' which I also loved. Dev has put a lot of effort into making a cool UI...took a while to get used to the 'hold/long press' method to select things or make actions. The combat feels a bit clunky however and selecting weapon targets feels cumbersome. But overall totally AAA game.
Great space game. I like it better than FTL.
Best Sci-Fi game on the Play Store!
A fun time
Amazing game, fun and fair gameplay and a wide variety of options to choose from, lovely game with a fun story to match

Combine FTL, Advance Wars, Honor Harrington, Dune, and a hint of Altered Carbon, and you've got Crying Suns. Wonderful game, best played on tablet as some of the symbols are a bit tough to see on a small screen. Still, freely pausing and getting to know your squadrons helps. Worth every penny.
Please add zoom in battles, other than that, it's awesome.

Great experience, it plays quite like FTL with it's own unique style 5*. The art is great and the story telling is very refreshing. I have one complaint with quality of life mechanics missing. As it stands you have to tap multiple times to deploy your drones and weapons. This gets worse with 3+ drones and weapons. Most of the battle you're tapping to setup targets and not actually playing. There should be an auto fire at selected target for weapons and an auto deploy for drones.
Great sci-fi game for mobile. Highly recommend!
This game is addictive, i gotta say the graphics are very good props to the devs

Had an issue with crashes after an android update but this seems to have been sorted with a fresh install of the game. Really enjoying this again now. Playing on a Google pixel 3a my only gripe is that the text is a little small for a phone this size.
replyContent: Hi, sorry to hear you’ve been experiencing some crash issues. Please contact us at contact@cryingsuns.com and share as much information as you can. We will definitely investigate your case. Thank you for posting!

content: Lots of good story. Really nice game.

Pros: 1. An actual game (no ads, no time limits, no "energy," no premium currency). 2. FTL-like, with really neat strategic battles directing multiple ships. 3. Tons of homages to Dune and Foundation 4. Great pixel art. Cons: Would really like to zoom in on battlefields.
Very fun game with a great atmosphere

If you've ever played FTL: Faster Than Light, and enjoyed it... You'll enjoy this. Beautifully crafted story so far, and I'm always seeking out the combats where possible. There's not many strategy games that work on a mobile, but they've found an awesome balance of RTS and functionality. My only criticism is: the controls for reapplying ships to the docks SUCKS. Click, hold, click, hold, click, hold, destroyed 3 second later. Repeat. RSI enducing.
Awesome game with a very interesting story... Definately worth its pricetag

This game is phenomenal. It really combines everything...just bought it and played 5hours straight. The team behind this project really put they very best to deliver something new. It is my first investment on a game...and it is very well deserves it...looking forward for what comes next...please have a look also on hade's star which is a game I also adore...in my mind if you combine both...boom...mind explosion!
Fun game. Run a system as a bite-sized piece and pick up where you leave off. The battle system takes a bit to wrap your head around, and there's a lot to track sometimes, but it's fun.
Repetitive...was addicted to ftl but felt this fell short...the gameplay was bland, battles are boring even if challenging at times. The story is mundane, real slow, uninteresting..

Bought the game 2 months ago, can't play it because the font is too small and it hurts my eyes after a few minutes and in this game there are a lot of dialogs. I'm still waiting for the devs to make the font bigger. P.S: I have a 6.7 inch display but it isn't enough.
replyContent: Hello Carlos, If the dialogs font were bigger, would that be enough for you to make the experience acceptable? We ask because we have very little room to make the interface texts bigger but it would be easier to do so for dialogs only.

content: Was hoping something more akin to the game FTL but this is good in its own way, ill say that I'm glad the pause button works because doing this at real time on a phone would be next to impossible.
Excellent game, easy to pick up and play. Could use a manual save system but a very enjoyable game.
Fun Distraction
Great complex rouge game !
Very poor writing, but otherwise game is so good that it still deserves 5.
Outstanding
Very good game for SF fans, especially Dune.
Exceptional game. Great story arc. Fun to play. Some measure of repetition in the random encounters, but minimal.

Fun and challenging; the ship battles I'm still getting used to but I am enjoying all of it so far. Just need to figure out when best to use specific fighter types and weapons. At the moment, I'm doing sort of a spray and pray, hit 'em with everything we've got approach which seems adequate but wasteful.
Rad.
Played through chapter 1. So far it's everything I hoped it would be and more. I love FTL and this has taken it to a new level with massive story and strategy.

The text is way too small to read without a magnification glass. The text and object colors of your opponents on the tactical map are so poor, it is difficult to zero in on the targets. If not for the above poor decisions from the developers, I would give this game 5 STARS. End of Message.
Definition of great value. This game has amazing story, wonderfully stylized graphics, & interesting and engaging gameplay. Quite literally the best mobile game I have played in years.
Awesome game, loving it. Very immersive story.

I was looking for copper and found GOLD! It is a brilliant game, with mixed feel of nostalgic 2D graphic with modernized attention to detail and tone of atmosphere. I like the sense and scale of the in-game universe and the lore as well. Rather than just playing for the sake of the battle and loot, I was drawn into uncovering the mystery of the storyline. Finally the soundtracks, they are just awesome!
Fun. Space combat.
Great game, not ideal on a phone.

Excellent game, if you're thinking of buying it you should. Love the story, the gameplay and strategy are fun and exciting. Pixel art is amazing, music perfectly fits the tempo. I would buy the second one or any dlc if it ever comes out

Fun so far. Finished my first playthrough and was successful on easy. Gonna give it a few more playthroughs before updating to 5 stars. If i get bored before then i'll leave it at a 4 and thats based on price alone. And to give the devs some inspiration to add more things. Really solide game tbh but battle is a bit meh. Reminds me of a condensed Stellaris
Is a nicely done game with a cool story so far, i just cleared the first cluster :D
Did not enjoy the combat
Really fun FTL like game. For a mobile game I can't really expect much else. Solid fun game, tons of replayability.
Superb! 5/5! A++
Kinda stressful. I wish the game had a dog in it that stood beside my person to help with the stress. Clone them doggos
Soooo addictive. Love it
My only complaint is that the "holding" function to deploy is hard to get used to. Other than that, great rougelike and has a nice story to boot.
A good port of a good game!
What a brilliant game, thanks developers for such amazingly beautiful masterpiece

I really want to like this game because it's got an awesome premise and story. However there's just one aspect that really kills it for me; the space combat. I'm afraid I found it tedious, fiddly and just not satisfying. I think it should be more autonomous, rather than having to micro manage every single unit action. But hey that's just my humble opinion. Shame, as this game does so many other things so well.
Truly Amazing and engaging dialog
Excellent

+2star for good graphics\overworld. -1star for deleting my previous review. -1star for making the dialogue box too small. It hurts my eyes straining to read it. No option to make the dialogue bigger. -1star for OP enemies on Normal\Hard mode. Easy difficulty is fairly balanced for new players, but normal\hard will see you steamrolled by enemy units strong enough to beat you even with a type advantage after chapter 3.
replyContent: Hello Matt, I'm sorry you had this experience with the difficulty, have you tried playing the game on easy difficulty? The game is much more forgiving and might provide a better experience for you.

content: Fun game with an in depth and cool story
Graphic are well done. Plot and decision tree are lacking. Was also expecting bit more depth the combat and exploration. Feels very repetitive and I lost interest pretty quick.
Brilliant

I love this game. It's exactly what I'm looking for when I search for a space based strategy game. Love the story and art style! Amazing mechanics and an all around great game. I highly recommend this to anyone interested.
Bad ass
This game is too good for how few people know it

Pretty fun, you select a ship and it generates a path of randomized encounters culminating in tougher fights. The RNG is pretty thorough as no 2 runs are the same, with chance encounters to unlock permanent crew to help with later playthroughs. Each run can last 15-20 minutes if you skip most of the dialogue so it fits perfect in most break times and you can quickly jump into a fresh run if you get shafted on percentages. The rock-paper-scissors type of squadron management is also pretty fun.

This game comes with (but is not limited to); • Fantastic design Music/effects/visuals that put nearly every other mobile game I've played to shame. • An INTERESTING storyline Involved and intricate, the story keeps giving for a long time. • Tons of content So, SO much variability between runs... Several "chapters" that unlock new things and present new challenges, rougelight unlockables, hundreds of possible events for each planet you explore... • Great strategic gameplay Get the game.
Good fun.

Much as I love the game. I can't get over how even on easy mode the odds can be overwhelmingly against the player. Keep it that way for those who want it. The game could've been awesome 8f it wasn't for the rage quitting element. I wish that was a category I could see, I'd avoid spending money on those kinds of games.
replyContent: Hello, We are sorry that the game made you feel that way. Have you tried playing the game in easy mode? rng is much more forgiving

content: Awesome game! Pretty addictive and difficult with a great storyline
Fun game! Engaging, challenging, with a good storyline
Cleverly thought out, no micro transactions and sometimes a real challenge. Best mobile game for me since xcom!
Very fun.

Amazing. Simply amazing. Would have paid twice as much without any regrets. I went to watched Splattercat play this on youtube, and thought it interesting. But the Steam reviews are what sold me. If you like Dark Souls level hard difficulty, if you like tactics-based gameplay, and if you want an interesting story to keep you coming back after you yeet your phone at the nearest small animal in frustration, then buy this game. Don't second guess yourself. Buy it ...and possibly a new phone case.

This game is pretty amazing. It's definitely worth the money. The story is just as impressive as the graphics. I just beat the game. I have to be honest it's one of the best games I've played in a long time. I really enjoyed the story.

This is a very entertaining strategy game. If you have played FTL you will find obvious similarities, and those are only good. The battles could be a bit more diverse. You have three main "modules" during combat that you need to consider, but they're not all that deep. You also have to frantically recheck your squadron's (fighters) docks to see if they're available or repaired, and that gets old fast. This game has potential, but it could do with some redesigns here and there.
AAA game short learning curve to learn, 7hrs now havnt put my tab s7plus down yet!
Great game. Great way of describing history of the empire. Especially if you know a little about the Dune or Foundation universes.
Hanger bugs often forcing a restart and evtualky giving up because craft do not deploy
replyContent: Hello, We are sorry you experienced this issue. A new version has been released (2.1.2) that fix the bug you experienced, you just have to update the game

content: I rarely buy games this expensive on Android but it's been worth every penny, if you're a fan of FTL or strategy you'll love it. It's the perfect sort of game for touchscreen controls. As a bonus, the Devs are very responsive to issues, had a slight bug, emailed and they fixed it very quickly.

It pains me to say this, but the tutorial could be a little more thorough given the depth of this game. Still, after you lose a few times - to be expected in a roguelike - several parts of combat get pretty clear. That said, this is as deep a game as you'd want to play on your phone, with great scripting and a really engaging story. Having to manage ship weapons and squadrons of dependent boats at the same time can get to be a bit much, but now I'm just nit-picking.
Great

It's a very good game. I like the story even though I only just finished Chapter 1. The mechanics are good but I could use some more scraps. :D The game occasionally simply closes itself which is very annoying. I'm still giving 5 stars because I enjoy every moment of it.
*BUG* since update can't equip things during battle after putting phone to sleep. I'm using a razor phone 2.
replyContent: Hello, An update should fix this issue if you update to 2.1.2

content: Great procedural rogue-like. Gameplay is very similar to FTL
I like Herbert's work and FTL like games thus I like Crying suns. It is logical
Good game, took time to learn to play well and the story was fun.
Great One. Good game play, story, strategy, thought provoking, and of course, so refreshing to not have a single request for additional money. Support this developer.

Interesting game. Starts to get repetitive quite soon. After playing it longer the Asimov-style story and some nice design touches still made me change to 5 starts. Cloud save would be useful but copying the save game files to my new device still saved the day. Thanks!
replyContent: Hi, we are sorry for the inconvenience.The cloud save is not supported but you can either copy the save folder from your previous phone to the new one (file can be found here: Android/data/com.altshift.cryingsuns/files/saves/save0/) . If you don't have your save anymore, contact us at contact@cryingsuns.com and we'll provide a new one.

content: This game is quite fun! Only finished the first chapter so far and it took several hours.
Very unique and stress inducing at time game.

(Edited) had a game-breaking bug first week of owning the game where you couldn't select anything on the main menu of the game, effectively ending any chance of playing it right there. Well, that got fixed. Now I have a new bug. There is no audio whatsoever. Yes, all my audio options are turned ON and at max volume, but the game is still 100% silent. No matter how many times I try to close & reboot the game, it is still like this. Starting to wonder if I'll ever get to change my 1-star rating...
replyContent: A new, big update is coming on the 29th this month, could you try again then and tell us if the problem persists? You can also contact us at contact@cryingsuns.com so that we can exchange and try to pinpoint the issue. We are very sorry that you are experiencing those breaking issues :/

content: Worth every cent
This game is great. The story, combat, and RNG. I was abit taken aback with every chapter you have to restart your ship, But it functions well.
This game is awesome. No ads. Great game play. Unique each play through. Hot damn
Bugged or does not work. Either way this is the least intuitive game and without a tutorial.. trash, save your money.
replyContent: We are sorry to hear that, could you tell us more about the problem your are facing at contact@cryingsuns.com so we can help you?

content: Similar to Faster Than Light. This is a fantastic game for mobile devices. Im losing sleep over it to be honest. Story is very good so far. I just hit chapter 4. Difficulty is there for those who want a challenge.
Great game and story
Nice challenge and story line
It's like Faster Than Light but with a more detailed story and more tactical. It's own unique game which you can see love and attention poured into it. 5/5
Excellent game! FTL-lite, with engaging world building. I readily recommend.
This game is great. If you love FTL, you will love this game. Worth every penny.
Really really fun and engaging. Thanks devs!

Great game, two annoyances. It won't install on my tablet, and the small font is very difficult to read on my phone. Also could use a help section, though the controls are good enough to figure things out on one's own.
Finally, FTL for phones, but better.

The game looks interesting, but unfortunately the text size and menus are way too small for phone screen. I can barely read any words or click the tiny buttons. Accessibility is not good for this game, shamefully. I refunded after few minutes of struggling.
Great game, kind of FTL mixed with star trek. I'm digging it

It's been a while from the last time I played a game as this one. Good story, varied mechanics, tons of decision making with impact on gameplay. Specially, a game complete in itself. Thank you deeply for the experience!
Nice game love the story
Beautiful game. In depth story. Perfection
Very challenging, but rewarding experience. Adding impact to the choices you make on the world in subsequent runs is a very nice touch. Controls on mobile are kinda clunky though.

At last a truly good game that is not a cash farm. If you are looking for a bit of quick strategy without endless ads and cash grabbing "booster packs" (yes let's pay 99 bucks for imaginary boosters) then this is the game for you. Quite a sharp learning curve but worth it. Great work to the developers. Just one thing to add, please add a save after the boss fight at elysium. I didn't have time to read all the dialogue and now have to fight a difficult Boss again
If you enjoyed FTL you will LOVE this game.
It is very good 10/10 would recommend and did
Excellent and well worth the few bucks. Plenty of replayability. Play it nightly.

userName: The Matt Case Of Comedy: Comedy Hour
content: good game
Its well worth this price!!!! Crying Suns is very similar to FTL. The main difference I've noticed is the fight system. Its a pay once, unlock all game and I highly respect that!
Beautiful, plays well with touch, controller, or kb/mouse.
I have this on PC and love it, this is an excellent port of the game
Wow this really is great.
Worth the buy.
Great game, controla were awesome, story was amazing but some parts were wordy, skip feature was very appreciated

Very good roguelite space game. It has a good story so far. Recommend playing on a large screen due to small font, but it works for me on my Pixel 4a. Space combat feels great, very tactical. Remember to use asteroid fields for cover, and retreat your ships for repair before they get blown up!

I paid for a game and I got a game. Complete, it was great. Beyond that it's a lot of fun and this company will absolutely get my money in the future if they produce more quality games with no adds or in app purchases.
Clearly made by passionate Devs. Worth the cash!
Great game, but needs ability to adjust text and ui scaling, at least for dialog. Will bump to 5 when we get that

Dying suns is tactical roguelike-lit, that has a nice story and fun gameplay. Originally PC game, the developer made a nice mobile version. I highly recommend this game. You can pick it up and play for a few minutes or hours.
Slight learning curve, but what a great ride this game is! Wonderfully animated, intriguing and well written story.
One of the best rouge-like i have play!!!
Amazing graphics and story. Love how everything is randomized with many upgrades and customization. This game is a must for all SciFi and exploration lovers.
Fun game with a engaging story
Awesome FTL rouge like game! The story is really cool and thought out and the RTS aspect of the surface battles is alot of fun!
Addictive, beautiful to look at, and an intriguing story.
Great game very similar to ftl. Not too bad on my phone but I do wish there was a zoom function during battles
Thoughtful game.

Absolutely every part of this game is amazing. The story evolves as you play. The graphics are simple yet engaging. The mechanics are involved and yet still easy to understand. My only gripe with the game is that there is no obvious manual save feature, meaning that if you close the game or terminate the process the game will wind you back a decent amount. This has caused many battles including a particularly long one against "Mother" to be lost on retry and hours of game play thrown away.
Good, but please add the option to ever so slightly increase the font size
Best game. Can't stop playing it
Unexpected excellence. No shuddering. Learning controls was simple. Beautiful scenery. Reminiscent of FTL vanilla. Worth the price of admission for sure. Gl hf

Excellent game, worth the money as it is a full game, no adverts, no micro transactions, just a pure gaming experience like the good old days 😂 If you like FTL this is very similar and plays excellently on mobile devices. Bit of a battery hog which is a problem only because it's addictive! Super the developer and buy this game, hello get rid of the current trend of micro transactions and horrible game play.

I was going to get this in steam but then I saw it available here which is great because this game is perfect for a touch screen. No bugs so far. Game design and audio are top notch. This game has an interesting survival aspect to it that requires some attention. The random events have been cool, although hoping they turn out in your favour is another thing all together.
Good game, reminds me of Faster Than Light. On mobile a little difficult to read.
Recommend it for everyone. Great battles, detailed storyline, and lots of difficult choices.
Very engaging game.
Fun on a bun
Just made it through the first chapter love how it's just one simple payment for a good game
Almost completely unplayable on a standard smart phone. Items are just too small to keep track of. Probably great on a tablet, but would not recommend for a phone size. Waste of money.
Loving it so far. Great game.
ftl with a story, and micro-management of squadrons instead of crew. amazing tactical game.
The best mobile game I've ever played

Really thoughtfully created game... Worth the money, far better than constant stupid in game purchases... 5 stars because it is actually great and because I want more of this and less of idle style games that get you no where. This game makes you think.

This game is amazing. It plays sort of like a simplified version of FTL: Faster than Light with a pseudo chessboard for squadron to squadron combat. The real good part is the story, however. The dialogue is very well written, the major characters are memorable, even the ones with very little screentime, and the plot just constantly keeps the player guessing. 5/5 stars. Get this game!
FTL meets Dune and Foundation. If you like FTL and space epics, you'll enjoy this. Also it's beautiful.

It's FTL, but the strategy stuff is different. It has a long overall gameplay time (playing on hard forces you to actually learn the intricacies of playing well), it's own culture/story, and it's beautiful. You won't regret buying this if you're a real gamer because this is a full game, unlike most mobile games. Edit: Idk if the text scales up with screen size. It was just comfortable on my big screen. Beware of that.
Do you like FTL? If you said yes, then quit reading and get this game, you'll love it. Simple as that.
Great but I feel like the interface needs to be reworked for mobile.
High quality rogue-like similar to FTL. One of those rare mobile games that isn't cash harvesting trash.
Best game ive played on android
Excellent roguelite - strong writing and dark brooding atmosphere.
Awesome game.
What a fun friggan game
Super beau jeu et bon gameplay.
Best game I could ask for.

One of the best games on the app store, story artstyle and customization is really great, I really like getting good officers for planet expeditions, only complaint is I dont like the combat and would rather something similar to FTL
This game runs great on my galaxy note 9, I would say it's very much like ftl combined with some rts elements in combat. I needed a game like this on my phone. Thank you guys!
Good game but can be very difficult.
Boop Boop De boop
I really enjoy this game.
Incredible game, font is a bit small but it has just the right amount of immersion, depth and storytelling! Hyped for the upcoming DLC on android.
Good roguelight.
Amazing game - great sci-fi plot, gameplay, and soundtrack. Much better on a tablet, esp with a pen.
I love this game
Lots of fun. Seems repetitive, but it keeps you going. Lots of challenges and gets better as you go. Like it a lot!
This game is awesome, especially if you use a stylus
Best Android version of something like FTL I have ever played.
The tutorial want great but I've had a lot of fun so far
Definitely worth it's price, but be sure to have a large phone or tablet, as all things in this game are tiny, from the text to the play area.
Pretty great game wish normal was slightly easier usually I do normal but this time it's a little too hard also needs a little more randomised and scripted scenarios.
Awesome game!
Dune meets Foundation meets Rogue. All on my phone. Tough to play but good story and gameplay
Interesting scifi story, nice tactical combat, easy to start and stop when needed. Haven't run into any negatives so far, feels like FTL with a more interesting story/combat
Its a basic ftl very fun only complaint would be writing size but then again I am playing on a s9 plus not a tablet
Nice game
Perfect controls, beautiful art style, and a fantastic game.
This is one of the best mobile PC ports I've ever seen. If you put a lot of hours into FTL, buy this game
Possibley the best phone based games I have ever played. Highly recommend.
Loving it
Gud Game
Great game! If you liked FTL, you will also like this gamd!
Badass. I don't buy games but Dune and Foundation? Yeah.
Great game. It would be nice to have some sort of zoom option or a way to make the UI bigger / text easier to read
Got me in the feels, well done

Fun game, has a lot of content I have only scratched the surface. I own it on Android and iOS. Both are great. Hope to see more game from this developer. Thanks for letting us enjoy a masterpiece like this on mobile.

Love the game, but I have a large phone and it's still hard to see everything. Wanted to play on my galaxy tab, but says incompatible even though it's the latest model. Seems odd, it'd be perfect on a tablet.
replyContent: Hello, we will continue to improve readability as much as possible on phone and the next update, in a few weeks, should improve things a bit. As for the tablet it's more about the gpu model than about being recent. Galaxy tab S 3 and above model should be compatible, but "A" model (budget one) have a much cheaper gpu :/

content: Just completed it for the first time. Absolutely brilliant game. Many lost hours!!
Brilliant roguelike. Reminds me of FTL but with different real-time combat and much more storyline. only problem is the small text - it seems designed for a screen larger than the average phone

I love this game! The graphics are beautiful and amazing, the story is intriguing, and though it can be pretty difficult and you can get super unlucky, the gameplay is awesome and always keeps me entertained! I highly recommend this game to those who like space exporation/survival games-anyone in general really.
I had a technical issue with the game and the team was quick to respond to resolve it. Thank you!
replyContent:
Hello Jamie,

On the main menu you should see the "current" chapter, the normal behaviour is that the "new game" starts in the current chapter. So the "new run" should start in chapter 6. However if the current chapter is not chapter 6, please contact us at  contact@cryingsuns.com we could provide with a new save so that you can continue properly.

content: Challenging and fun!

Couldn't play the actual game. The text is too small to read. I combed through the options and there's so setting whatsoever for text scaling. Since I couldn't read the menus without a magnifying glass, I never got to try the actual game itself.
replyContent: We are sorry for the inconvenience, we did our best to make it fit phone screens but it still looks like that for some people it's still too hard to read. The next update should improve readability a bit, in a few weeks  If you feel like it, could you contact us a  contact@cryingsuns.com and send us screenshots about the blocking parts for you?

content: Great on tablet. Would be nice if this could be played on my (Samsung A7) phone too.
All i can say is that this game is so investing and extremely worth it
Wanted to play ftl, got what I asked for.

One the best mobile games i have ever played. So much thought and detail went into this game you can clearly see the passion the devloper has for this game. I look forward to seeing more games done by this devloper and wish them the best of luck.
I love the game
Easily a 5 star game...if it would stop randomly crashing on my S9

Excellent But There is one thing missing from this game and its simply the ability to finish it. The game is nicely balanced all the way through apart from the end of the first chapter when facing mother. I would say impossible to complete the game so I ask the makers can you please make a cheat mode so that you can at least complete the game. It is impossible with only one Hull left by the time you face Mother and with multiple squads of aircraft just not doable. For the missing star please ADD
Amazing.
Fantastic story. I did not expect such a vivid universe from a mobile game.
Well made and a nice, constant style
Crying Suns is a fantastic roguelike experience that is similar to FTL. And unlike FTL, it has an interesting story that has me intrigued enough to keep playing.
Perfect balance between old school decision based RPG and strategy. I love it.

I rate it a five for a reason. This isn't for those that expect a lot of hand holding the moment you start. In fact, as you barely progress, you realize it's going to be tough. And this game runs on that fact. Hence the story and the way its driven. I barely made past the first chapter. And honestly, despite how cruel it is with how easily you can lose to a boss. It reminds you, get up and try again. This time what will you do? And I love it for that. I would love to leave more. But for now. ♡~
Best game on android imo.

I don't rate games often but this one really deserves it. It feels like a spiritual successor to FTL, only with more strategy and a more flushed out story. If you like sci-fi adventures and have played/enjoyed FTL, this one is a go, 100%!
Great game for sure, there is a learning curve, but once you get that down its pretty fun. The story is interesting so far. Enjoy slaying some scrapper thugs.
For a fan of old science fiction, this game gives a fun and challenging experience with a lot of replayability and many different paths to explore.
Just finished my first playthrough. The game was fun the whole way through. The story was especially good. I enjoyed slowly unraveling the mystery!
This is the best android game I have ever played.

Revised: Running on Pixel 3XL. Run without logging into Google Play in-game and you should not have trouble. I appreciate the developers responding so quickly to my review. Plays with a map interface similar to FTL and includes some other elements into a brilliant and beautiful game experience. Game load time is acceptable and file size is pretty good. The in game text is really tiny and there is no option to enlarge text. This leads to quite a bit of eye strain. This is something that could easily be done without compromising the game. Fix this and I will give the game 5 stars.
replyContent: We are sorry for the inconvenience. It looks like it might be a problem with the google play games service that does not load properly and block the game. Can you try restarting your phone? Also can you try changing network as it might be connectivity related? Let us know if it didn't fix the issue, you can also contact us at contact@cryingsuns.com

content: Loving this game. Unforgiving but satisfying when you clear a chapter or finish a fight without taking too much damage.
This game is kicking my ass..but not in a bad way. It's challenging and one wrong decision can break you...or not. Nice graffics, story, combat. Get it.
This game is a challenging and rewarding experience. It is very good. The only reason I dont give it 5 stars is the text is so small it hurts my eyes to read.
super good! everything choice has weight.
Great game. Worth the money

Was a great fan of space real time combat like games. When I saw reviews of this game saying it was a better FTL I had to try it. Combat is reaponsive and fun to partake in. The story is also immersive and you have enough choices. Overall, it is a good game but I wouldn't say it has that casual feel of FTL but it has its own genre.
Fun, sci-fi rpg. No micro transactions!
Really great FTL inheritor for Android, interestinb style and game play, lots of surprises.
Lousy U.I. Battle system is confusing, combat is sort of enjoyable...It would be better if I didn't have to jump through hoops to launch ships and fire the guns. And the words are usually too small.
The best game I've played on Android. Lovers of sci-fi rejoice!
Great game. If you enjoy FTL then you'll probably enjoy this.
Great FTL type game. Well thought out, with enough depth to make you actually read the game text.
Absolutely great

Hands down the best mobile game I've ever played. Pros: Great Pixel art Fun Combat Cheap Hours of enjoyment Great story! You get constant refreshers so the game doesn't punish you for putting it down. Gripes: By chapter 2/3 you know all the beacon event choices to make, and you just repeat them over and over again. I would pay for a PC version of this game that had 3-4x more events, and story options. The ship selection is a little lack luster.
fasinating

Excellent! It has the rougelike feeling from FTL, but it also addresses my main issue with FTL, namely a lack of control and agency in the rqnrom things that happen. In this game, sound strategy can really make the difference between a good and bad run, and you can point to the mistakes you made in combat as the moments that put you behind the curve for the run. But there is always more to unlock and explore, so even a doomed run is not a waste. It makes everything worth it. Amazing game.
Fantastic and challenging game. Definitely worth the cost. I recommend using a stylus to play, if possible.
If you like ftl you'll love crying suns, very well adapted to android the experience is good on tablet and even on mobile.
Great fun, a little ftl plus some additional strategy. I enjoy the added layer of chapters to tell a story and the variety of missions at each location.
A hard yet fun time
Good strategy Space Game

Game design is good, game play is reasonable, the interface leaves much to be desired when played on a phone just due to screen size, the story seems reasonable at first but by the end it becomes almost offensively bad and only gets worse up through the end.
Loving it
Really good once you get into it. Took me a bit to figure out the battle dynamic and that you can upgrade your ship. Great story and gameplay. Worth the money.
Fun game, and an entertaining storyline.
Well balanced. If you like this, then you might also like Out There: Omega.
Fantastic and frustrating at the time. Definitely not an easy walkthrough but the challenge makes it worthwhile.
I love Ftl and I've been searching for years for something that hit that space combat roguelike itch the same way. This has it in spades. Great work!
Pretty cool game. Works great on mobile
Good fun with an intriguing story. Sometimes hard to see things but not impossible.
Nice balance of some FTL and Dune. Intriguing story so far.
Engaging and fun. I have been playing for several hours in total and not bored yet.

Well crafted . Excellent in all categories. Playing on a Samsung note 10 lite with zero bugs. Really great using the stylus with this game. Super addictive. Cool story progression for what it is. Kudos to the developers for this. Absolutely worth the money.
An amazing strategy game with a great story and well done controls.
Best strategy mobile game ever. Great atmosphere and setting Few things like dialogue can get repetitive.
Amazing game.

Amazing game. If you played FTL on the PC, it is very similar but focuses on a rock-paper-scissors style space combat instead of the interior ship micromanagement simulator. Solid visuals. As most games, it burns battery but not as fast as other games I have played. Finished chapter 1 and really enjoying it so far.
Super fun. FTL plus style game play. Small recommendation would be to change the font to something bigger and brighter.
It's fun, worth every cent
Epic! Good gameplay, awesome storyline. It's just amazing!

Awesome gameplay, great graphics, intuitive controls, and a gripping story. The atmosphere is engaging, and combat is consistent without becoming stale. There are no ads, no IAP, and plenty of hours of replayability. It's a great value, and it will really hit the spot for anyone wanting console/PC level gaming on mobile.

Bought on phone to use on my $1000 chromebook, went to download and google store said not compatible with my hardware, BS. I had to download a pirated version to play a game i already bought on my chromebook. That plays just fine.. this is rediculous. EDIT|| Then you should just allow it to run on Chromebooks and just say the disclaimer. In my expirence every app blocked by the playstore for hardware, worked just fine when I went threw the trouble to download and install it.
replyContent: Sorry for the inconvenience. There is a lot of different Chromebooks with different hardware, and a lot of them have low capabilities video cards. We also design this Crying Suns version for mobile handheld so we cannot guarantee sufficient performance, quality of service and interaction on Chromebook devices.

content: Never play games like this. But something about it caught my eye. While only an hour in I realised why everyone loves it and has a score of 4.8. Its relaxing yet action packed. Think modern chess with a cool sci fi skin and brilliant music. I'm a fan instantly!!! Re'edited review 4 hours in.... Brilliant game buy it!!
Great gane for a quick playthrough. A lot like FTL with a capital ship, but the combat is fun, the interactions unique and the story is engaging.
Expanded FTL experience
Like FTL, better. Epic story, cool graphics, controls hold up across the board. Very solid. Good job Devs!
Great
Amazing. The story is great and its very strategic. Its my perfect sci fy game
I like you get what you see
Beautiful game!
Enjoying the game. Finished the first chapter on the 5th attempt and looking forward to many more runs. Overall a solid addition to my mobile collection.
Best paid game on a phone

The same style as FTL, but with a unique gameplay and a great storyline. A beautiful, well-crafted game worth trying. Lots of variability in tactics. Personally wish it had more unlockables and more replayability.
Cool game
Wow!
A fun little rogue-like-ish ship simulator
Good game, enjoyed so far

This is a terrible game.... If you plan on being productive or if you hate watching hours of the day "magically" disappear. Starts a little slow but stick with it, this is truly a gem of a game. There is a constant sense of tension that feeds that one-more-turn itch. No microtransactions, no ads, just an amazing game. If I had one nitpick, it's that sometimes the battles run a bit long. Crying Suns get the highest possible recommendation I can give for this type of game.
It's an incredible game with an interesting universe and engaging combat.

This game is a clearly a straight up ripoff of FTL but that's a good game and this is the first mobile game I've enjoyed in years. Fun game loop, nice pixel graphics and solid story. Definitely worth a buy.
Great lil game. Bit of a steep learning curve but they did a fine job meshing the best parts of other games. Just remember, you will die, you will start over, but you will "grow" to love it.
Combat is too complicated and the text is too small to read
I love it. It's choose your own adventure meets roguelike, in the great genre family of games like Out There and Faster than Light.
Well-written, beautiful 2D and 3D pixel art, decent story and replayability. A mobile game that feels like a genuine handheld console game instead of a disposable money-grubbing timewaster.
Great, fun. No in game purchases, is skill to win. Good buy
Fantastic game! Battles are complex and every amount of resources are significant to battle and ground mission outcomes. Never a full moment.
Beautiful and cinematic. The cold visuals combine perfectly with the haunting ambient effects. The gameplay is FTL in overdrive. Five of five.
Maybe not *as* good as FTL, but definitely good and no IAP.
Good game. I become engrossed in it when I play.
This game is great I really wasn't expecting how great it would be from the gameplay to the story to the different ships and how they play am glad I bought this
Fun in the best ways possible. This game makes you want to play just one more turn, then another, and another. Very interesting Sci-Fi story, where death or glory wait around every turn.
Slightly confusing game at first, but once you get it it's awesome! Now I can't stop playing! Excellent game well worth buying :) especially when you have time to kill!

This game will brutally twist your mind apart, It's one of the best on Google, it has a repeativnes about it, but that is the magic of it how it has been put together, it plays with all your emotions, you will hate it then love it, 10 out of 10
👏 AMAZING.
Fun little rogue like game... simple story interesting mechanics
This game has a great story, looks pretty and grabs my attention with great space exploration. The battles are engaging and fun. There is some repetitive aspects but the replayability is quite fun.
A nice space rogue-like with a decently compelling story. Has a good bit of content to keep you entertained for multiple playthroughs.
well designed rougelike in space. plenty of references that scifi fans will recognize. good replayability. can be hard to read on a small screen
Very much like FTL but still unique. Definitely worth the money.
Great little strategy. Similar to FTL, well worth the price tag 👍
Game rocks! Give it a chance, and unlike almost every game , I haven't had to deal with a single ad!
Love it
Great sci-fi kinda RTS game with a compelling story. Worth the $9 bucks. Took me almost 3 hours just to beat chapter 1.
Wow, this game! It's amazing. I'd give it more stars if I could. It's well worth the purchase.
Tactical, challenging, fun as hell. People are seriously sleeping on one of the best games of the type on the store. Absolutely outstanding!
Easy to learn and difficult to master. This game has an enjoyable mobile experience for what was already a good game
One of my favorite games I've ever bought on Android. ❤❤

I've been looking for a good paid game and bumped into this. This rogue like adventure is really fun. Not a fast paced game (not a bad thing) and the battles are engaging and take some good thinking to win. The risk reward scenarios add to the fun as well. I play on my note 9's stylus. I think the interface works really well on this port of the game. If using fingers, it might be a little frustrating but that's a guess... don't let it deter you. Give this a shot! I have no regrets :)
Love it. Great pick up and play from where you last left off type. 5 stars for dialog and progression. Fun RTS like battles. Replay value on higher difficulty.
Ftl on steroids
Two or three days of play. Its good but not worth more than £5.
Unreadable text, unusable interface, longest intro, didn't get to combat before got bored

I hate when developers think that their mobile scoped game is worthy to be a pc game. And this happens too many times in the indie comminity. I have been following this title from developer groups since very early stages and I thought it has potential but not to be a pc game. I waited until the mobile version is released and I bought it on the first week. Now I think this game is way more than a mobile game and I want to see it on my 4k monitor. See ya on pc!

One of the best mobile games I've been lucky enough to discover. The game loop is tight, and the combat is both simple to understand but challenging at times. The encounters are random but I didn't feel like they were unfair.
Perfect

Great FTL inspired game with nice nods to the Asimov Foundation series. Would be nice to see squadron refresh times without long press in tactical pause. Hard mode seems to only be doable with Jericho ships and lots of luck. Unique Specialists should not be limited to a five run cool down and multiple should be available on start (game gets more difficult on replay otherwise, as you cannot collect them again after discovery)
Awesome game! Also a very helpful developer when I had a problem installing the game!
if ftl became a grid-based game where you control a carrier
I'm 4 chapters of in. 3 A.M. this game is too good, someone help me.
Fun gameplay, but the battles are a little hard to see on mobile sometimes. Being able to zoom in on particular areas would be nice.

An excellent game with a rps combat. The only thing stopping me from 5 stars is something you hear over and over with this title. The font is BRUTAL! Reading it is possible, but eventually I get a headache from the small size and mixture of the dark background(and darker graphics) and the thin very white text. With very simple changes this problem could be a thing of the past! Customizable size, font, and color would make all the difference.

This is what I wish more mobile games were like. This has captured my attention more than any other mobile game I've played. Amazing story, great gameplay, and an art style and sound track that ties it all together. Despite the high price I'd recommend this to anyone who enjoys space strategy games.
Fun and interesting, reminds me of FTL but darker and maybe more complex. Worth the money.
Great game. Thanks
Game kept me up way past when I should of been asleep trying to beat chapter one. Very interesting story and game play.

Great roguelite game, I can say without a doubt that this is the best strategy game on the app store as well as in my experience the best mobile game I've ever played. The decisions and anomalies make this game reminiscent of Stellaris in some aspects but with a much more story rich focus. If I was to compare this game to anything it's sort of like if you combined Stellaris and FTL but it definitely has it's own unique features and does the genre well. Super cheap for such amazing quality!!
Great game!
Super challenging and rewarding. I like it better than FTL!
Really the best rouge like space game on Android.
Spectacular FTL style game. Animations and design are too notch, if you liked FTL this is a perfect game to play on mobile.
Room for some QOL improvements to the port, also an in-game guide of some type would be great and a great chance to flesh out the lore even more!

Well designed RTS and the choice system reminds me of FTL. Story is well designed and each play thru feels different that it keeps you wanting to play to see if you will finally beat the chapter. Graphics are amazing for a mobile game. Almost like it was designed for it. If you like strategy games, then this one is a must have.
Very nice, indeed. A game close to FTL and very addictive. Uses a lot of battery though, just like Neo-N fuel ingame :D
A long, enjoyable experience. Something to stay up too late to clear one more system. The graphics and audio work pair nicely for the effects. Extremely worthwhile purchase!
Kaliban and Idaho off to the the Imperium of Man from heretics and the chaos dark gods. FOR THE EMPEROR!

Best game I've played on mobile in years. Extremely strategy based, and it gives you the feeling that your choices you make effect the rest of the storyline. Dialogue is even engaging, and you have to be prepared for hundreds of different outcomes. Easy 5 stars for the developers of this game, well done and never give up your passion. ❤️
I love it, but the text is super tiny on the phone. I have a big phone too, so getting to middle age and need some bigger text, but other than that it's really fun. Just a bit of squinting
Solid story, robust game play, tons of replay ability.
Im still in the early stages,but still game really looks promising. Gameplay is really nice.
Beautiful graphics and sound effects, I got a refund for this game because the UI and dialogue was just way way to small for mobile phone. If ever that's fixed I would play the game again.
Played it for hours
Very well optimised for mobile, Great story, really fun Roguelike gameplay.

Awesome game! Work on the story and universe can be seen everywhere, lots of details. I like discovering the universe bits by bits like Amiral Idaho. Gameplay is super fluid! I cannot recommand this game enough even if the price is a bit high, this game really worth it!
Stuck on launcher, doesn't work. The presented by humble bundle freezes it
replyContent: Hello, It could happen if the app hasn't downloaded properly. Can you try uninstalling it and reinstalling it?

content: Like a less goofy FTL. Great aesthetics, compelling story, intuitive interface.
Great visuals and easy to grasp gameplay definitely easy 5/5
Very fun game :)
Good

So far so good. Music is amazing and mysterious. It's beautiful and colorful. The gameplay is mixed with choices and consequences, strategy, and awesome explosions. Just finished chapter 1, let's see if it gets better.

Highly addictive, reasonable gameplay pace and speed. Tactics required, even on easy, it is a challenge. Gameplay is like a top down strategy with rts elements while commanding units (up to 4) based on hanger bay. Think of FTL but with the micromanagement of power now a micromanagement of weapons, deploy, recall units, and "specialists"
Great game, good port from PC
Fantastic game with an interesting story and solid pausible real-time combat. The pixel graphics and music are outstanding as well. The UI is good but very tiny even on my 6.4" screen.
Excellent port. It would be good if the later updates includes font size increase option or zoom feature. Kudos good game... Thank you for bringing this wonderful game on mobile.
Amazing. Worth every penny.
A really well put together game! Very fun! I died a lot at first but once you get into it, holy moly its good! Great job to all involved!
Worth every cent. Best game I've played in a while.
Kinda sorta FTL but more story driven, more in depth combat, less arcade style. Overall a great game, one of the best I've played on mobile
As someone with over 250 hours on the steam version, I can say this is a solid port

Edit- Thanks for the speedy reply! Yeah Uninstalling and reinstalling it worked. I'm gonna put three stars for now till I actually play it. It gets stuck on "presented by Humble Bundle" screen and goes no further. I'm on the S20 plus. Will update my review once I play the game lol.
replyContent: I'm sorry to hear that, it might be related to an issue when downloading the expansion file of the game (OBB). Can you try uninstalling and re-installing the game? if the problem persists you can contact us at contact@cryingsuns.com so that we can try other things to make it work :)

content: Great roguelite/rts
Great so far... Little predictable, but fun.

This game is Amazing. There is nothing quite like it. SciFi SRPG with strong storytelling. More complexity and role playing than FTP, though I do see some slight similarities. Totally worth checking this out 👌

Basically ftl but more modernized and amazing game for mobile. Ive been wanting to play ftl on my phone for a long time and this is the closest thing and the similarities are there. With the exception of controlling your crew, and battles are a bit different but its fun none the less.

This is a well designed, thematic game that I've already enjoyed on the PC. I like it enough to buy it twice, but unfortunately the initial release was not compatible with my Android device. I sent the developer a note asking if they could add my device to the compatible list, hoping that in a few months they might get to it. But they did it in days. So this is five stars for the game, but also for the team behind it. Between the detail and design in the game, and the brief interaction I had with the team that created it, it could not be clearer that they care about doing an amazing job.

I played the demo a while ago, and there were some issues with that which are completely fixed now. How much the game has changed is incredible and I really like playing it. Perfect music, perfect gameplay, and I really like the story. The best thing for me is the art style though, it's absolutely beautiful. I would definitely recommend this game, probably one of the best I've played so far in 2020.
Awesome game. Cool story and very much like an in depth ftl. Enjoying it so far! Keep up the good work devs!

Outstanding game, it's very similar to FTL or other roguelikes, but with some permanent progression as you hit milestones in the game. The story is engaging, the writing is great, and it has a really unique graphical style that marries pixel art and smooth 3D.

Awesome game experience. Control is slightly different than the PC version but the gaming experience is still awesome. It isn't just space battles. I think of it as a 'Star Trek' like experience with encounters, away missions and actual results from decisions you make. Only difference is there isn't a 'Federation' that's going to help you out of stuff.

Honestly, this is a PC quality game at a mobile price. It shares a lot of DNA with FTL, but the combat is more real-time strategy than the FTL combat, while the ship maintenance is more 4X simulation. It's a great combination of mechanics with a lot of depth and a shocking amount of story and progression for a roguelite. Highly recommended.

10/10 This game scratches every FTL itch possible with a stunningly vast amount of lore. The gameplay loop is incredibly solid and is perfect for small burts of gameplay or even one run (1 hour+). I'm baffled I had never heard of this game at all let alone on mobile. Worth way more than the price point and I eagerly await DLC if that is ever going to come.
A great successor to FTL. Can't recommend enough. Makes me want to revisit a ton of sci fi.
good game, save deleted itself though
Amazing Game!! This port is perfect, I use to play it on pc, but I'm now in love with the mobile version.
THIS IS THE BEST MOBILE GAME I HAVE EVER PLAYED!
Loving the game strategy wise it's great!!

Purchased it on PC and was very excited to see it release on mobile. One of my easiest recommendations, if it seems interesting to you, it's worth getting or at least trying (peep that free demo on steam). The pixel art is breathtaking and the soundtrack is perfect. I look forward to more from the creators and the future of this game
FLTish with better graphics. Finally a good game from that genre on mobile.
Really enjoyed my first play though have my desplay set to wqhd+ made a huge difference to the text in game
Love the pixel art, and it is a good phone port. Awesome

Crying Suns is a wonderful example of where I hope more mobile game developers can head towards. I have this on PC and couldn't wait to get again here. Gameplay is fun and varied enough that I look forward to seeing how each game unravels and the mobile controls are fantastically intuitive. Had a compatibility issue and the response was professional, fast, and personal. Hats off to Alt Shift and all involved with this game.
Amazing game, addicted

Very in depth game, description is very accurate. I would venture to say that it's a bit more accessible than FTL, and I welcome that. That's not to say it's not a challenge, as the game can put you in various pinch spots.
Great translation of a fantastic PC game!
A great port!
Excellent port of a great PC game. Works flawlessly on my Asus ROG2 but you should add an optional zoom up to 1.5x at least in the combat map.
Been waiting for this game to come to mobile for a long time! Thank you am excited to try, so far it does not disappoint!

This is one of my favourite games. The lore is immersive and keeps you hooked, the story-line is deep and interesting. The game-play can get a bit samey after a while, however that doesn't matter because the art style is beautiful with a happy mix of pixel art and 3D models. I would recommend this game to anyone who has played and enjoyed FTL.
